700345f-a.text:
West 230th Street (right, not seen), south side, at the foot of Corlear Ave. The driveway, here seen, is the vehicular entrance fo the Kingsbridge freight depot of the New York Central Railroad. It runs parallel to West 230th Street, the distance of one block from the foot of Corlear Ave. to the foot of Tibbett Ave. (where automobile house is located). The freight house is at this date (1937) being used bv the Mayone Co. of New York, mason suppliers; a new, large and modern freight station having been constructed within the freight yards east of Corlear Ave. The driveway is about 15 feet south of West 230th Street
and is separated by a fence.
October 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

700799f-a.text:
Corlear Avenue, west side, north from W. 230th Street.
About 1924
Committee on Housing
Charity Organization Society
V2 Ne. 66

700800f-b.text:
Corlear Ave., east side, north from West 230th to 231st Streets, showing six 2.5-story frame dwellings,the last two of which bear Nos. 3022 and 3026 respectively. Also shown are the rears of the St. John's R.C. Church and the Protestant Episcopal Church of the Mediator,
both facing on the west side of Kingsbridge Ave.
October 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date.
May 25, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
